page.title: 14JOHN OPIE OF ST.AGNES
page.content: JOHN OPIE WAS BORN AT BLOWING HOUSE, LATER RENAMED{HARMONY COTTAGE,}NEAR ST.AGNES IN 1761. HIS FATHER WAS A CARPENTER AND JOHN FOLLOWED THE SAME TRADE,BUT HE ALSO DECORADED THE WALLS OF THE COTTAGE WITH PORTRAITS OF HIS PLAY_FELLOWS . THOUGH ENTIRELY SELF_TAUGHT, HE WAS BY NATURE A PAINTER , ESPECIALLY OF PORTRAITS. HE WAS COMMISSIONED TO PAINT A PORTRAIT BY THE KING AND WAS ALSO INTRODUCED TO SIR JOSHUA REYNOLDS , PRESIDENT OF THE ROYAL ACADEMY. HE RAPIDLY BECAME FASHONABLE AS THE "CORNISH WONDER", AND HE BEGAN TO EXHIBIT AT THE ROYAL ACADEMY IN 1782. HE ALSO LECTURED AT THE ACADEMY BECOMING A FAMOUS PROFESSOR OF PAINTING. HE PAINTED ABOUT 750 PAINTINGS AND DIED IN 1807. SOME SAY FROM OVER WORK,OTHERS SAY HE WAS POISONED BY THE LEAD IN HIS PAINT. HE WAS BURIED IN ST.PAULS, CATHEDRAL.
